page.title: 15FARMING
page.content: There are{10 farms ranging from 2 {acres}to{over 400 acres.}There are{2 {dairy farms producing 60,000 gallons of{milk}between them annually. Some of the{milk goes to the dairy in {Kingskettle, the remainder to the Milk {Marketing Board}in{Dundee.}One of the {largest farms}is{Horticultural supplying{leek, cauliflower, cabbage, {lettuce & sprout plants to Kettle {Produce.}There is a{2 acre farm producing{32,000 eggs weekly.}There are{3 huts in which 6,500 hens are {accomodated.}They also{sell fresh {vegetables throughout}the{year.}They {sell milk}as a{service to}their {customers. There}are{five mixed farms {growing turnips, sprouts and barley. {Cattle and sheep are bought at the {Border Sales and fattened in Fife.
